descrip: Fuji TX-1. This panoramic camera is the one I often carry to shoot for myself.
One Tajikistan bill. It’s about $0.2.
Japanese earpick. I can/'t find Japanese ones here, so I keep this. You can get chopsticks everywhere, but not earpicks.
Japanese mother-and-baby notebook provided by the city of Kyoto. I keep a bunch of old documents just in case.
DVD of Russian popular serial Interny. Someone in Kazakhstan gave this to me. I/'ve never watched it. Sometimes you end up keeping stuff that is not so important for reasons you don’t know...

Pouch and Coins. The metro tokens are from Kiev and St. Petersburg. The coins are: a rare old one from Kazakhstan, a Swiss one and a Tunisian one that someone gave to me in exchange for a Japanese coin. The pouch was a gift from a passenger from Air Astana. I use it as a wallet or passport case.
Hermann Hesse postcard. I got this at a museum near Lugano, Switzerland. He was one of my favorite authors as a teenager.
Sim cards from Eastern Europe and Central Asia. I store them in SD card or lens filter cases.
CD of Psoy Korolenko called Ruskoe Bogastvo Volume II (Russian Treasure (or Russian Wealth) Volume II).
Two magnets from Almaty, Kazakhstan. Sometimes, I buy too many souvenirs, so some of them become my own.
German tablets that work well for hangover.
Cigarettes called Russian Style. These are cheaper than Kent, and better than Winston, I think. (They cost about $1.50).
Kodak Film ISO 200 that I’ve never used but carry around. This must have been x-rayed a lot.
An old German camera.

A Japanese Talisman. This is called Omamori in Japanese and it’s supposed to keep you out of trouble. I'm not superstitious but my mother gave it to me so I have to keep it. I got into trouble a lot, anyway, but maybe it helped keep me out of the worst times.

Jewish cap. When I was in the synagogue in Bukhara, this cap reminded me of a friend. So I bought him one as a souvenir. I don't get out of Eastern Europe/Central Asia much and shipping is also expensive or/and unreliable. So I still keep it.
Ricoh GR1v that I bought in Japan for a photographer friend but then he sold it back to me later.
Three mini-books of Lenin, Basho and Pushikin that I carry sometimes but hardly read.
Expired Romanian presscard.
Orthodox icon
